content.description: Question 5 asks you to identify a pitch pattern that is played. You will have ten seconds to read the choices, and then you will hear the musical example played twice, with a brief pause between playings. Now listen to the music for Question 5 and identify the pitch pattern that is played.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: A stack of four whole notes in bass clef. The pitches are D3, F-sharp 3, A3, and C-sharp 4.
A stack of four whole notes in bass clef. The pitches are D3, F-sharp 3, A3, and C4.
A stack of four whole notes in bass clef. The pitches are D3, F3, A3, and C4.
A stack of four whole notes in bass clef. The pitches are D3, F3, A-flat 3, and C4.

content.answer: A stack of four whole notes in bass clef. The pitches are D3, F-sharp 3, A3, and C-sharp 4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
